Literature Review: Protoplanetary disk chemistry plays a crucial role in the formation of planets, as it influences the coagulation of dust grains, the elemental and molecular compositions of the mature planet, and the structures and dynamics of the disk itself. The chemical evolution of the disk molecular reservoirs is a complex process that involves the interaction of various physical and chemical processes, including condensation, chemistry, and dynamics. In this review, we will discuss the protoplanetary disk chemistry of the volatile elements H, O, C, N, S, and P, and explore the links between disk and planet chemical compositions.
